intro: Adenachaena parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved adenachaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Adenachaena parvifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
